  "article_text": [
    "several antiferromagnets having plural magnetic ions or magnetic - ion sites show an interesting magnetic long - range order ( lro ) . in cu@xmath0fe@xmath0ge@xmath7o@xmath8 , cu@xmath3 spin dimers ( spin 1/2 )",
    "are coupled to fe@xmath9 spin chains ( spin 5/2).@xcite an indirect fe - fe exchange coupling via cu dimers was observed.@xcite this result reveals that the cu dimers play the role of nonmagnetic media in the indirect magnetic interaction .",
    "dynamics of dimer excitation in staggered and random fields generated by fe spins are also experimentally identified.@xcite in cu@xmath1mo@xmath0o@xmath10 , three crystallographically independent cu@xmath3 sites exist ( cu1 , cu2 , and cu3 )",
    ". spins ( 1/2 ) on cu1 sites form antiferromagnetic ( afm ) chains.@xcite two spins on neighboring cu2 and cu3 sites form an afm dimer . each afm chain is coupled to afm dimers .",
    "only a component parallel to the @xmath11 axis of magnetic moments on cu1 sites is ordered below the afm transition temperature @xmath12 k in the zero magnetic field.@xcite perpendicular components are ordered in magnetic fields parallel to the @xmath13 or @xmath14 axis .",
    "a canted afm lro is stabilized only in finite magnetic fields .",
    "it is inferred that magnetic competition causes this unique lro .",
    "in addition , the canted afm lro disappears in cu@xmath1mo@xmath0o@xmath10 with a very small amount doping ( _ e.g. , _",
    "0.2 % zn for cu sites).@xcite    negative magnetization is an interesting phenomena .",
    "it was first observed in li@xmath15(fecr)@xmath16o@xmath7 spinels @xcite and was explained using the nel model.@xcite in this model , two collinear sublattice magnetizations ( @xmath17 and @xmath18 ) with different temperature ( @xmath19 ) dependence are considered .",
    "@xmath20 is larger than @xmath21 below @xmath22 , while @xmath21 is larger than @xmath20 below a compensation temperature @xmath23 .",
    "if directions of the sublattice magnetizations are fixed , magnetization is observed as a negative value below @xmath23 .",
    "several compounds showing negative magnetization have been found .",
    "some of them are considered to be explainable by the nel model,@xcite while for the other compounds the origin is different or has not been determined explicitly.@xcite details of the origins will be described later .",
    "we have paid our attention to li@xmath0ni@xmath0mo@xmath1o@xmath2 .",
    "two crystallographically independent ni@xmath3 ( spin 1 ) sites exist ( _ m_1 and _ m_2 ) as represented in fig .",
    "1.@xcite the _ m_1 and _ m_2 sites form distorted honeycomb lattices and linear chains , respectively .",
    "about 25 % of _ m_1 sites and about 50 % of _ m_2 sites are occupied by non - magnetic li@xmath24 ions as shown by the formula li(li@xmath15ni@xmath25)(li@xmath15ni@xmath15)mo@xmath1o@xmath2 .",
    "unexpectedly , we found negative magnetization at low @xmath19 .",
    "to investigate the origin of the negative magnetization , we determined the magnetic structure of li@xmath0ni@xmath0mo@xmath1o@xmath2 using the neutron powder diffraction technique and determined its static and dynamic magnetic properties using the local probe technique muon spin relaxation ( @xmath26sr ) .    ) and _ m_2 ( @xmath27 ) sites in li@xmath0ni@xmath0mo@xmath1o@xmath2 .",
    "the space group is orthorhombic @xmath28 ( no .",
    "62).@xcite these sites are occupied by ni@xmath3 ( spin 1 ) or li@xmath4 ( spin 0 ) ions .",
    "the occupation ratio of ni@xmath3 ions is 0.757 at _ m_1 and 0.566 at _ m_2 .",
    "the ratio between ni numbers at _ m_1 and _ m_2 sites is 0.728 : 0.272 .",
    "three short _",
    "m_1-_m_1 bonds exist and form distorted honeycomb lattices .",
    "m_1-_m_1 distances are 3.03 , 3.08 , and 3.75   at 10 k for the first , second , and third shortest _",
    "m_1-_m_1 bonds , respectively .",
    "the respective exchange interaction parameters are defined as @xmath29 , @xmath30 , and @xmath31 .",
    "the shortest _",
    "m_2-_m_2 bonds form linear chains .",
    "m_2-_m_2 distance is 2.53  .",
    "distances in the other @xmath32 bonds ( @xmath33 or 2 ) are larger than 5.06 ",
    ". distances in _",
    "m_1-_m_2 bonds are larger than 5.19  . , width=302 ]",
    "crystalline powder of li@xmath0ni@xmath0mo@xmath1o@xmath2 was synthesized using a solid - state - reaction method at 973 k in air for 144 h with intermediate grindings .",
    "we used an isotope @xmath34li ( purity : 99 % ) for neutron - diffraction samples to decrease absorption of neutrons .",
    "we confirmed formation of li@xmath0ni@xmath0mo@xmath1o@xmath2 using an x - ray diffractometer ( jdx-3500 ; jeol ) .",
    "li@xmath0ni@xmath0mo@xmath1o@xmath2 is insulating at room temperature .",
    "we measured magnetization using a superconducting quantum interference device ( squid ) magnetometer ( mpms-5s ; quantum design ) .",
    "we entered powder in paraffin molten by heating in the zero magnetic field and fixed finally the powder in solid paraffin .",
    "we measured magnetization of the powder embedded in solid paraffin .",
    "probably , powder directions are randomly distributed and powder reorientation does not occur in the magnetization measurements .",
    "specific heat was measured using relaxation technique with physical property measurement system ( ppms ; quantum design ) .",
    "we used a sintered pellet in the specific - heat measurements .",
    "we determined the magnetic structure of @xmath35li@xmath0ni@xmath0mo@xmath1o@xmath2 from neutron powder diffraction data .",
    "the experiments were conducted using the high - resolution powder diffractometer for thermal neutrons hrpt @xcite ( wavelength @xmath36  ) and the high - intensity cold neutron powder diffractometer dmc ( @xmath37  ) at the swiss spallation neutron source sinq in psi .",
    "powder was filled into a vanadium container with 8 mm diameter and 55 mm height .",
    "rietveld refinements of diffraction data were performed using the fullprof suite program package.@xcite symmetry analyses of possible magnetic configurations were conducted using the program basirep in the fullprof suite program package .",
    "the muon spin relaxation ( @xmath26sr ) measurements were performed using the dolly spectrometer at the @xmath38e1 beamline at the swiss muon source ( s@xmath26s ) in psi . in a @xmath26sr experiment",
    "nearly 100  % spin - polarized muons are implanted into the sample one at a time .",
    "the positively charged @xmath39 thermalize at interstitial lattice sites , where they act as magnetic micro probes . in a magnetic material",
    "the muon spin precesses about the local magnetic field @xmath40 at the muon site with the larmor frequency @xmath41 ( muon gyromagnetic ratio @xmath42 mhz  t@xmath43 ) . with a lifetime of @xmath44  @xmath26s",
    "the muon decays into two neutrinos and a positron , the latter being predominantly emitted along the direction of the muon spin at the moment of the decay .",
    "measurement of both the direction of positron emission as well as the time between muon implantation and positron detection for an ensemble of several millions of muons provides the time evolution of the muon spin polarization @xmath45 along the initial muon spin direction . in a powder ,",
    "2/3 of the local magnetic field components are perpendicular to the @xmath39 spin and cause a precession , while the 1/3 longitudinal field components do not .",
    "the damping of the oscillation is a measure of the width of the static field distribution experienced by the muon ensemble . in a static magnetic environment ,",
    "the 1/3 fraction of the muon spin polarization is conserved . in a dynamic magnetic materials",
    "however also this so - called 1/3-tail relaxes and the relaxation rate can be , in certain limits , related to magnetic fluctuation rates . since @xmath26sr is a local probe technique , the amplitudes of the different signals observed are a measure of the corresponding volume fractions . with this",
    ", it provides a direct measure of magnetic volumes which is not easily possible with scattering techniques . for further details of the @xmath26sr technique",
    ", we refer to the recent review in ref .",
    "figure 2 portrays the @xmath19 dependence of the specific heat in the zero magnetic field .",
    "a peak is apparent at 8.0 k. as it will be shown later , magnetization increases rapidly on cooling below 8.0 k. therefore , the peak indicates occurrence of a magnetic phase transition at @xmath5 k.    ni@xmath0mo@xmath1o@xmath2 in the zero magnetic field . ,",
    "width=302 ]    figure 3 ( a ) shows the @xmath19 dependence of the magnetization @xmath46 of li@xmath0ni@xmath0mo@xmath1o@xmath2 in a very weak residual magnetic field .",
    "the value of the magnetic field was estimated as @xmath47  t ( 0.63 oe ) from paramagnetic magnetization values in this field and 0.1 t. the magnetization increases rapidly below 8.2 k , shows a maximum around 7.2 k , and decreases below 7.2 k. it should be noted that the magnetization is negative below 4.2 k. we did not observe any difference between magnetizations measured for increasing and decreasing @xmath19 .",
    "figure 4 represents the magnetic field @xmath48 dependence of @xmath46 at 1.7 k after the residual field cooling process .",
    "we can see a small residual magnetization and hysteresis .",
    "the rapid increase below 8.2 k and small residual magnetization indicate appearance of a canted afm lro or ferromagnetic ( fm ) lro with small magnetic moments . figure 3 ( b ) shows the @xmath19 dependence of @xmath46 in the field of @xmath49  t. we can see a hysteresis between magnetizations measured in the residual field cooling ( rfc ) and field cooling ( fc ) processes .",
    "the absolute value of @xmath46 in the fc process is larger than that in the rfc process . in 0.1 t",
    "3(d ) ] , only the fc magnetization becomes negative . in 0.2 t",
    "3(e ) ] , both the rfc and fc magnetizations are positive . in 1 t",
    "3(f ) ] , the hysteresis is small .",
    "figure 3 ( g ) shows the @xmath19 dependence of paramagnetic susceptibility in 0.1 t. the susceptibility above 20 k obeys the curie - weiss law .",
    "we determined the value of the curie constant as 1.12 emu k / mol ni from the data above 200 k. the @xmath50 value was calculated as 2.11 on the assumption that the spin value is 1 .",
    "this @xmath50 value is reasonable for ni@xmath3 spins .",
    "ni@xmath0mo@xmath1o@xmath2 at low @xmath19 in various magnetic fields .",
    "open and closed circles indicate data measured in the rfc and fc processes , respectively .",
    "( g ) temperature dependence of the magnetic susceptibility and its inverse in the paramagnetic state .",

    "width=302 ]    figure 5 depicts the neutron powder diffraction pattern of paramagnetic @xmath35li@xmath0ni@xmath0mo@xmath1o@xmath2 recorded using the hrpt diffractometer with @xmath36   at 10 k , which is slightly higher than @xmath5 k. the refinement based on the crystal structure of li@xmath0ni@xmath0mo@xmath1o@xmath2 as determined by room temperature single - crystal x - ray diffraction @xcite well fits the experimental neutron diffraction pattern at 10 k. structural parameters are presented in table i.    li@xmath0ni@xmath0mo@xmath1o@xmath2 at 10 k ( higher than @xmath6 ) measured using the hrpt diffractometer ( @xmath36  ) .",
    "lines on the observed pattern and at the bottom show a rietveld refined pattern and difference between the observed and the rietveld refined patterns .",
    "hash marks represent positions of nuclear reflections . ,",
    "width=302 ]    [ cols=\"^,^,^,^,^,^,^\",options=\"header \" , ]     figure 6(a ) shows difference between two neutron powder diffraction patterns of @xmath35li@xmath0ni@xmath0mo@xmath1o@xmath2 at 2.0 k and 10 k collected using the dmc diffractometer ( @xmath37  ) .",
    "the reflections of the difference pattern can be indexed in the chemical cell with the propagation vector @xmath51 .",
    "the profile matching le bail fit , in which the integral intensities are the refined parameters , shows that all the peaks are well described with * k * = 0 with the reliability factors @xmath52 , @xmath53 , and @xmath54 .",
    "the new reflections appear below @xmath6 .",
    "therefore , they must be magnetic reflections .",
    "using the determined propagation vector , we performed a symmetry analysis according to izyumov _",
    "et al._@xcite to derive possible magnetic configurations for the space group @xmath28 .",
    "the space group has eight one dimensional irreducible representations ( irs ) .",
    "the observed magnetic patterns were compared with calculated patterns using the structural parameters determined from the structural refinement . after sorting out the basis functions of all eight irs",
    ", we found that only @xmath55 well fits the experimental pattern .",
    "the ir @xmath55 has the following characters 1 , -1 , 1 , -1 , 1 , -1 , 1 , -1 for the symmetry elements listed in the caption of fig .",
    "the magnetic moments of ni2 atoms are restricted by @xmath55 symmetry to be parallel to @xmath11-axis , thus forming a ferromagnetic sublattice .",
    "the @xmath56-components of ni1 spins are also forced to be ferromagnetically aligned , whereas the spins in @xmath57-plane have antiferromagnetic configuration with basis vectors listed in the caption of fig .",
    "li@xmath0ni@xmath0mo@xmath1o@xmath2 at 2.0 k and 10 k ( magnetic neutron diffraction pattern ) measured using the dmc diffractometer ( @xmath37  ) lines on the observed pattern and at the bottom show a rietveld refined pattern in le bail profile matching mode and difference between the observed and the rietveld refined patterns .",
    "hash marks represent positions of magnetic reflections .",
    "several indices of the reflections are written .",
    "( b ) a neutron powder - diffraction pattern at 2.0 k. lines on the observed pattern and at the bottom show a rietveld refined pattern for the magnetic structure model @xmath55 and difference between the observed and the rietveld refined patterns .",
    "upper and lower hash marks represent positions of nuclear and magnetic reflections , respectively . , width=302 ]    in the refinement of the magnetic structure , all the atom structure parameters were fixed by the values obtained from hrpt data ( table i ) .",
    "the magnetic structure is depicted in fig .",
    "the magnetic moment at the ni1(1 ) position is ( 0.27(4 ) , 0.04(12 ) , -1.58(3))@xmath58 and its magnitude is 1.60(3 ) @xmath58 at 2.0 k .",
    "the ordered ni1 moment mainly points along the @xmath14 direction with a small component along the @xmath13 direction .",
    "the size of the ferromagnetic @xmath11 component is refined to a small value close to zero within experimental errorbars .",
    "the arrangement of the moments indicates that the @xmath29 , @xmath30 , and @xmath31 interactions are fm , fm , and afm , respectively .",
    "the magnetic moment at the ni2(1 ) position is ( 0 , -0.6(1 ) , 0)@xmath58 .",
    "ni2 moments form the fm lro .",
    "the ni2 moment is reduced in comparison with ordinary ordered ni@xmath3 moments .",
    "the reduction may be caused by the one dimensionality of the ni2 spin system and large disorder due to about 50  % substitution of li ions .",
    "ni2 moments form fm lro . to show clearly the arrangement of ni1 moments , symmetry operators of _",
    "m_1 ( 8d ) sites are given .",
    "( 1 ) @xmath59 $ ] , ( 2 ) @xmath60 $ ] , ( 3 ) @xmath61 $ ] , ( 4 ) @xmath62 $ ] , ( 5 ) @xmath63 $ ] , ( 6 ) @xmath64 $ ] , ( 7 ) @xmath65 $ ] , and ( 8) @xmath66 $ ] . here",
    "@xmath67 , @xmath68 , and @xmath69 indicate components of the magnetic moment .",

    "( b ) @xmath72 and @xmath73 .",
    "( c ) the average spontaneous magnetization per ni @xmath74 .",
    "the solid line represents the rfc magnetization shown in fig .",
    ", width=302 ]    the ir @xmath55 well fits experimental data for all the measured temperatures .",
    "figure 8 shows the @xmath19 dependence of the magnetic moments .",
    "the absolute value of the fm component @xmath73 increases monotonically with decreasing @xmath19 .",
    "the afm components @xmath71 and @xmath75 have significantly weaker dependence of temperature with step like change at @xmath6 .",
    "the fm component @xmath72 stays close to zero with slight tendency to increase .    to further elucidate the static and dynamic magnetic properties of li@xmath0ni@xmath0mo@xmath1o@xmath2",
    ", we performed zero field @xmath26sr experiments for various temperatures . in fig .",
    "[ musr - spectra ] zero field @xmath26sr spectra are shown for characteristic temperature above and below @xmath5 k. figures [ musr - spectra ] ( a ) and ( b ) show the same data but plotted on different time scales to highlight the observed changes for the fast and slow relaxing signals . at high temperatures a slowly relaxing spectrum of gauss - kubo - toyabe form",
    "@xcite is observed .",
    "this is the fingerprint of a non - magnetic material .",
    "the small gaussian relaxation @xmath76 is due to static random nuclear moments only .",
    "below @xmath5 k an over - damped spontaneous muon spin precession is observed , indicating a very broad field distribution at the muon site(s ) , i.e. a complicated or disordered magnetic structure or many muon sites in the crystallographic lattice .",
    "this result is consistent with structural disorder caused by li ions .",
    "the @xmath26sr spectra have been fitted using the following functional form for the polarization function : @xmath77 with @xmath78\\,e^{-\\frac{1}{2}(\\sigma_{nm}\\,t)^2 } + \\frac{1}{3 } \\right)\\,e^{-\\lambda_{dyn}\\,t}\\ ] ] and @xmath79 here @xmath80 and @xmath81 represent the relaxation functions for the magnetic ( @xmath82 ) and non - magnetic ( @xmath83 ) volume fractions with their corresponding relaxation rates @xmath84 and @xmath76 , respectively .",
    "@xmath85 is the dynamic relaxation rate .",
    "figure  [ musr - para ] shows the obtained parameter values from the fits using the above equations .",
    "a sharp magnetic transition at @xmath5  k is observed in all the parameters .",
    "the magnetic fraction @xmath82 reaches @xmath86  100  % shortly below @xmath6 .",
    "the magnetic order parameter measured via the @xmath26sr frequency @xmath87 as well as the static field width @xmath84 continuously increase below @xmath6 .",
    "the values of @xmath84 are larger than the values of @xmath87 , indicating the very broad width of the internal field distribution . approaching the transition from above an additional exponential damping which increases towards @xmath6",
    "is observed .",
    "this is typical for the slowing down of electronic moments approaching @xmath6 . the corresponding dynamical relaxation rate @xmath85 is shown in fig .",
    "[ musr - para ]  ( d ) .",
    "below the transition @xmath85 is nearly zero indicating a static magnetic state .",
    "decreasing the temperature further , a dynamic relaxation of the 1/3 tail is observed again .",
    "this is already clearly visibly from the comparison of the @xmath26sr spectra at 7.6  k and 1.9  k in fig .",
    "[ musr - spectra ]  ( b ) .",
    "the dynamic relaxation at low temperature had to be fitted with a root - exponential time dependence ( eq .  [ root ] ) , which is indicative of a broad distribution of fluctuation times .",
    "interestingly , the dynamic relaxation rate starts to increase below @xmath88  k where the magnetization becomes negative .",
    "let us consider the origin of the negative magnetization in li@xmath0ni@xmath0mo@xmath1o@xmath2 .",
    "the nel model requires two fm sublattices that in our case are formed by the @xmath72 and @xmath73 components .",
    "the values of @xmath73 are negative .",
    "the values of @xmath72 are very small and show both the signs . at 2.0",
    "k , the error bar of @xmath72 is the smallest and the value of @xmath72 is positive .",
    "therefore , if the @xmath19 dependence of @xmath72 is similar to that of @xmath70 or @xmath71 , @xmath72 may be intrinsically positive .",
    "compensation of @xmath72 and @xmath73 is possible .",
    "the sublattice magnetizations @xmath17 and @xmath18 defined in the introduction correspond to @xmath72 and @xmath73 , respectively .",
    "@xmath17 has a weaker @xmath19 dependence than @xmath18 in the nel model .",
    "if @xmath72 is proportional to @xmath70 or @xmath71 , @xmath72 has a weaker @xmath19 dependence than @xmath73 as the nel model .",
    "we calculated the average spontaneous magnetization per ni @xmath89 and plotted it together with the rfc magnetization in fig .",
    "8(c ) . here",
    ", the proportion coefficient @xmath90 is calculated from the occupancies listed in table i. the contribution of @xmath72 is large in @xmath74 because of the large number of ni1 atoms . although the component @xmath73 shows well defined decrease with temperature lowering [ fig .",
    "8(b ) ] , @xmath74 is practically constant [ fig .",
    "the difference in the @xmath19 dependence of @xmath73 and @xmath74 suggests compensation of the fm components . a reversal of @xmath74 , however , was not obtained .",
    "the absolute values of @xmath74 seem much larger than the absolute values of the rfc magnetization represented by the solid line in fig .",
    "the negative magnetization is too small to be detected using neutron powder diffraction techniques .",
    "therefore , we could not verify the validity of the nel model .",
    "the magnetic scattering length was calculated as @xmath91 fm using a born approximation . here ,",
    "@xmath50 and @xmath92 are the @xmath50 value and magnitude of ordered spins , respectively .",
    "@xmath93 is the magnetic form factor and its magnitude is in the order of unity or less .",
    "the nuclear coherent scattering length of ni was obtained as 10.3 fm ( natural average).@xcite the intensity of bragg peaks is proportional to the square of scattering lengths .",
    "the lower limit of magnetic moments that can be evaluated in neutron powder diffraction experiments is about 0.1 @xmath94 . as is seen in fig .",
    "8 , error bars are in the order of 0.1 @xmath94 .",
    "the following four alternative models may be considered as the candidates for explanation of the negative magnetization effect . in model 1",
    "applicable to gdcro@xmath1 or ( la_re_)cro@xmath1 ( _ re _ = pr or nd),@xcite magnetic moments of cr ions form a canted afm lro , while _ re _ ions are paramagnetic . a dzyaloshinskii - moriya ( dm )",
    "interaction exists between cr and _ re _ spins .",
    "the main ( @xmath95 ) component of the cr moment produces an internal magnetic field parallel to the @xmath96 direction on _ re _ ions .",
    "the polarization of paramagnetic moments on _ re _ ions induced by the internal magnetic field is aligned opposite to the canted components parallel to the @xmath96 direction .",
    "magnitude of sum of the canted components is larger than magnitude of sum of the polarization of the paramagnetic magnetization below @xmath22 , while the latter becomes larger than the former below @xmath23 .",
    "the direction of the main component of the cr moments is fixed .",
    "therefore , the direction of the canted component is also fixed . as a result",
    ", the negative magnetization appears in gdcro@xmath1 or ( la_re_)cro@xmath1 ( _ re _ = pr or nd ) . in li@xmath0ni@xmath0mo@xmath1o@xmath2 , the distance between ni1 and ni2 sites is larger than 5.19  .",
    "probably , exchange interactions between ni1 and ni2 spins are weak .",
    "internal magnetic fields produced by ni1 ( ni2 ) moments on ni2 ( ni1 ) sites are small .",
    "accordingly , the negative magnetization in li@xmath0ni@xmath0mo@xmath1o@xmath2 can not be explained by the model 1",
    ".    in model 2 applicable to lavo@xmath1 @xcite or yvo@xmath1,@xcite only the canted component of the magnetic moment on v ions reverses and becomes anti - parallel to external fields .",
    "therefore , the negative magnetization was observed . in lavo@xmath1 ,",
    "a structural phase transition occurs just below @xmath22 due to the jahn - teller effect . as a result , the dm vector reverses and therefore the canted component of the magnetic moment reverses . in yvo@xmath1 ,",
    "the canting direction is determined mainly by the single - ion anisotropy at high @xmath19 and by the dm interaction at low @xmath19 . as a result",
    ", the canting direction reverses at low @xmath19 . in li@xmath0ni@xmath0mo@xmath1o@xmath2 , lro of ni2 spins",
    "is the fm order ( not canted afm order ) .",
    "consequently , the model 2 can not account for the negative magnetization in li@xmath0ni@xmath0mo@xmath1o@xmath2",
    ".    in model 3 applicable to ( smgd)al@xmath0,@xcite compensation between the spin and the orbital parts of the ordered moments occurs .",
    "we observe a sum of spin and orbital magnetic moments .",
    "therefore , the results in fig .",
    "8 indicate directly that compensation between the spin and the orbital parts of the ordered moments is not the origin of the negative magnetization .",
    "in addition , in 3d shells , only spin magnetic moments exist because of quenching of the orbital angular momentum .    in model 4 possibly applicable to sr@xmath0_re_ruo@xmath97 (",
    "_ re_= yb , y or lu),@xcite exchange bias ( eb ) effects @xcite may cause negative magnetization .",
    "the effects can appear in composites having both fm and afm lros .",
    "ordered magnetic moments of the two lros should be collinear .",
    "the fm transition temperature should be higher than the afm transition temperature .",
    "in li@xmath0ni@xmath0mo@xmath1o@xmath2 , however , ni1 and ni2 moments are nearly perpendicular to each other . only one transition was observed within experimental accuracy . in addition , distances in ni1 - ni2 bonds are larger than 5.19  , suggesting that interactions between ni1 and ni2 spins are weak .",
    "consequently , eb effects can not account for the negative magnetization in li@xmath0ni@xmath0mo@xmath1o@xmath2 .",
    "at present , we think that the nel model may be valid for the negative magnetization in li@xmath0ni@xmath0mo@xmath1o@xmath2 , although we can not prove the validity of the nel model .",
    "we can not deny perfectly possibility of another ( unknown ) origin .",
    "as was described in the @xmath26sr results , the dynamic relaxation rate starts to increase below @xmath88  k where the magnetization becomes negative .",
    "it is tempting to conclude that the magnetization inversion mechanism involves a dynamical process .",
    "as another idea , a structural change , which is not detected , may cause reversal of @xmath73 .",
    "experimental investigations into li@xmath0ni@xmath0mo@xmath1o@xmath2 using other techniques and further theoretical considerations are necessary .",
    "we studied magnetism of the spin-1 substance li@xmath0ni@xmath0mo@xmath1o@xmath2 .",
    "the spin system is composed of the distorted honeycomb lattices and linear chains formed by two distinct ni@xmath3 sites , ni1 and ni2 sites , respectively .",
    "li@xmath4 ions substitute about 25 % and 50 % of the honeycomb and chain ni sites , respectively , creating the disorder in both the spin subsystems .",
    "a magnetic phase transition occurs at @xmath5 k. in low magnetic fields , the magnetization increases rapidly just below @xmath6 , decreases below 7 k , and finally becomes negative at low temperatures on cooling .",
    "we determined the magnetic structure using neutron powder diffraction results .",
    "the magnetic order on both ni - sites develops according to a single irreducible representation @xmath55 of the space group @xmath28 and propagation vector @xmath98 .",
    "the honeycomb lattices show antiferromagnetic ( afm ) long - range order .",
    "the ordered ni1 moment mainly points along the @xmath14 direction with a small afm component along the @xmath13 direction .",
    "the size of the ferromagnetic ( fm ) @xmath11 component is very small .",
    "the ordered ni2 moment on linear chains has only the @xmath11 component and shows fm long - range order .",
    "the magnetic moment sizes amounted to 1.60(3)and 0.6(1 ) @xmath99 per ni - atom for the honeycomb - lattice and chain ni sites , respectively .",
    "the sharp magnetic transition at @xmath6 was also observed in the @xmath26sr results .",
    "the over - damped spontaneous muon spin precession below @xmath6 indicates a very broad field distribution at the muon site(s ) .",
    "the dynamic relaxation rate starts to increase below @xmath88  k where the magnetization becomes negative .",
    "we have examined several models known from literature that can account for the negative magnetization .",
    "the nel model that is based on the compensation of the ferromagnetic sublattices may be valid in our case , but our experimental data does not allow us to prove this model quantitatively .",
    "we are grateful to h. mamiya for fruitful discussion , to s. matsumoto for sample syntheses and x - ray diffraction measurements , and to m. kaise for x - ray diffraction measurements .",
    "the neutron powder diffraction experiments were conducted at sinq , psi villigen , switzerland .",
    "the @xmath26sr measurements were performed at the swiss muon source , psi villigen , switzerland .",
    "this work was partially supported by grants from nims .",
    "p. fischer , g. frey , m. koch , m. koennecke , v. pomjakushin , j. schefer , r. thut , n. schlumpf , r. buerge , u. greuter , s. bondt , and e. berruyer , physica b , * 276 - 278 * , 146 ( 2000 ) ; http://sinq.web.psi.ch/hrpt"
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> we studied magnetism of a spin-1 substance li@xmath0ni@xmath0mo@xmath1o@xmath2 . </S>",
    "<S> the spin system consists of distorted honeycomb lattices and linear chains of ni@xmath3 spins . </S>",
    "<S> li@xmath4 ions enter about 25 % and 50 % of honeycomb and chain ni sites , respectively , creating disorder in both the spin subsystems . </S>",
    "<S> a magnetic phase transition occurs at @xmath5 k in the zero magnetic field . in low magnetic fields , </S>",
    "<S> the magnetization increases rapidly below @xmath6 , decreases below 7 k , and finally becomes negative at low temperatures . </S>",
    "<S> we determined the magnetic structure using neutron powder diffraction results . </S>",
    "<S> the honeycomb lattices and linear chains show antiferromagnetic and ferromagnetic long - range order , respectively . </S>",
    "<S> we investigated static and dynamic magnetic properties using the local probe technique muon spin relaxation . </S>",
    "<S> we discuss the origin of the negative magnetization . </S>"
  ]
}
